Robert Nifkin is  a young man who struggles with ADD. He undergoes several ineffective treatments, both   medicinal and  alternative, before  discovering  focusing, a martial artsbased technique for  channeling his energy. Meanwhile, his mother's relationship with his  father  grows strained, and she begins  dating his Hebrew school  teacher. After his   bar mitzvah, Robert becomes more interested in  focusing and loses interest in pursuing other treatments for his  ADD. Eventually,  his father leaves to pursue a singing career in California, and his  mother and brother move to Pittsburgh with their surrogate family,  the Novaks. Alone in New   Jersey, Robert throws himself into his focusing practice  and eventually achieves mastery by channeling his excess  energy  into  successful multitasking. Later, Robert's family moves back to New Jersey, and he becomes preoccupied  with a new obsession: flipping coins.

In the novel, "Houseboy" by Peter Carey, an  aspiring writer namedRoss Milgate meets with    an accident that leaves him bedridden and  largely immobile,  prompting his wife,ivy, to  hire Jonny,  a young, light-skinned, Filipino man to   become the full-time "houseboy" and help care for Ross. As  the novel progresses, Ross's health begins  to improve, and he slowly starts to  recover his ability to walk. However, his recovery is fraught with challenges, as he   must come to  terms with his dependence on  Jonny and the  limitations of his own  body.

As Ross's relationship with Jonny deepens, he begins   to see the young man not just as a  caregiver,  but as a friend.  However, Jonny's past is full of trauma, and he  is  haunted by  his childhood   experiences as a slave to a wealthy family. As Jonny's past catches up with him,  Ross finds himself   drawn into a web of corruption,  crime, and  violence  that threatens to tear the young man's life  apart.

Faced with these challenges, Ross must decide what it means to  be  a friend and what it takes to stand up for  what is right. As  he struggles to help Jonny,  he discovers the power of forgiveness, compassion, and the importance of   fighting for justice. In the end, Ross  finds that the line between right and  wrong is not always clear, and that the best way to fight for  what is good  is  to listen to his heart and make the  choices that are most meaningful to him.

Sure! Here's  a plot summary of *Irish Thoroughbred*:

The novel follows the journey of a  young Irish woman  named Sinead, who  is determined to become a champion  racehorse trainer. Despite  the odds and the challenges she faces, Sinead remains committed to  her dream of training a winning horse.

Sinead's journey  is full of  obstacles. She must  compete against more experienced trainers, deal with the pressures of working in a male-dominated industry,  and navigate the complex world of horse racing. But she is not alone in   her  quest; she receives  help and support from her family, friends, and the  community.

As Sinead   works to achieve  her dream, she  discovers that the road to success is not always easy. She faces setbacks, losses, and self-doubt, but  she never gives up. With perseverance, hard work, and a little bit of  luck,  she  finally  achieves her goal of  training a  winning horse.

The novel is a testament to the  power of  determination  and   the  importance  of following one's dreams, even in the face of adversity. It is a story of hope, courage, and the  strength of the  human spirit.

Certainly! Here is the body of a plot summary for  a novel  titled *Petty Pewter Gods*:

"As the story begins, the reader is introduced  to Roy, a seemingly average man struggling to  make  ends meet. He spends his days working at a dead-end  job  and his nights alone in his small apartment, feeling lost  and hopeless. But  hidden deep within Roy is a spark of something more,  a desire for  something greater than his mundane existence.

One day, while walking through the city, Roy discovers a  small pewter figurine of a god in a  shop window.  The statue  speaks   to  him, offering him a chance to make  a  wish and change his life for the  better. Skeptical at first, Roy eventually makes a wish that surprises even him: he wishes for the power  to inspire others and make a  real difference in the world.

Suddenly, Roy's life takes an unexpected turn.  He discovers that the pewter god  has granted his  wish  and that he now possesses the ability  to inspire others  and bring about   change.  With this newfound power, Roy sets out on a journey to use  his gift to make the world a  better place.

As Roy works to fulfill his  purpose,  he encounters a variety  of challenges and  obstacles.  He faces criticism  and skepticism from  those who doubt his ability  to make a difference, and he  must  also confront his own doubts   and  fears. But  with the help of  the pewter  god and  the support of those he inspires, Roy is  able  to overcome  these obstacles and continue  on his journey.

As the story  progresses, Roy's journey takes him    to new and unexpected places. He meets  a variety of  characters, each with their own  unique  stories and struggles, and he works to inspire  them and help  them find their own purpose. Along the way,  Roy discovers that the power of inspiration is not just about changing the world, but also about changing himself and  finding  his own sense of purpose and meaning.

In the end, *Petty  Pewter Gods* is a story about the power of inspiration and the importance of finding one's own purpose.  It is a story about the potential that lies within each of us to make a difference in the world and to create a better future for ourselves and those around   us. It is a story  that reminds us that even the  smallest actions can have  a  profound   impact on the lives  of  others."

No matter  what secrets  she carried within  her, AliceHart knew that her life was about to change. Just moved  into a new apartment and new job,  she was commuting to   work  when she witnessed a  terrifying scene   a man ritually killing a person dressed  as a giant doll. Quickly moving on,   she decided, despite her better judgment, to explore the strangely captivating  world of the  performance artist  Arbitur, the man responsible for the  killing.

Alice finds   herself  plunged into a  surreal mystery, racing against time  to uncover  the truth about Arbitur and  his bizarre performances. As she digs deeper, she discovers a web of secrets and lies that threatens  to consume her. With the help of  her new friend and neighbor,  Sam, Alice must confront  her own demons and confront  the darkness that lies within.

But as she gets closer to the truth,  Alice finds herself in a race against time. For Arbitur has plans  for her, and  she may  not be able to escape his grasp.

Almost ten  years have passed since the  fight against   the Fascists.  It  is  now  the spring of  1948. The story  begins   as Senhor Jos, a  minor clerk in the foreign  ministry, arrives at an office in Lisbon to investigate a suspicious death. The victim,  an American journalist named Pinkerton, had been working on a book  about the Resistance movement in Portugal. But before he  could finish his  work, he   suffered a sudden attack of angina pectoris  and died.  Senhor Jos is  tasked with finding the man's murderer, and in doing so, is  forced to confront his own past as a member of the Resistance.  As he investigates the death of Pinkerton, Senhor Jos uncovers a web  of political intrigue  and betrayal that threatens to reveal the truth about the Resistance and tear the country apart. Among the suspects are a beautiful, mysterious spy,  a brilliant, but ruthless politician,  and a legendary, but  long-forgotten warrior.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Order  In August   1921, the United Kingdom and United States declared war on Germany  and Italy during World  War I,   but both Britain   and the U.S.  were unprepared to wage war.  The British and  French, in particular, were unaware of the growing power  of Marxist  and anarchist groups in Germany, and feared that this  power would  prove a threat to their ability to control the  war. They therefore drafted plans to eliminate those groups. The Black Order,  a German anarchist group, was  suspected of being a threat through many methods, such as attempting to  assassinate German members of the government and military and sabotage government installations. In November 1920, an unknown person shot and killed  Baron Hermann von  Kettler-Lwenstam, a leading figure  in the British government  and the military. Soon afterwards,  the British and French started  executing members of the Black Order. In May  1921,   Black Order member Gertrud Rindt  was executed at London's Gaiety Prison after being convicted of conspiring to  assassinate a British official. Black Order members suspected of being responsible for military action were shot by firing squads  and some had  their teeth   crushed in the process. Members of the Black Order were also sent to prison  on trumped-up charges, their lives destroyed. Many  Black   Order members were also detained after the assassination  attempts.  In a series of  raids carried out by the secret police, Black Order members were captured and executed  on the outskirts  of London,  the capital city of Great Britain.

The United States did  not  believe in socialism and would not  act on  any information that would suggest that it did. Crusader is  a fantasy novels  that  consists of five parts that follow a  young boy  going  on a journey with his  father, a knight, to a  far off land. The story is written by Jody LeFauve, who currently works as a freelance writer for The Hollywood  Reporter. The story was written for the 2015 Hugo Awards,  along  with the three first book of the  Inheritance Cycle. The plot synopsis  reads:  "The tale  centers  on a young boy  named  John, who is taken under the wing of an enigmatic, yet wise, woman called  Matron,  who is  part of a society called the  Crusaders. There, John  and Matron are reunited, and the boy finds true love in  Matron's household. On Matron's advice, John returns to King David's court. Now,  the boy must choose whether to be true to his heritage and seek out his birthright  or be  a  faithful servant, fulfilling the destiny his mother foretold."

It follows  his   journey from his birth, as his life slowly changes, to the discovery of his  family.

A series of novels based in  Spain during the  Spanish Civil War written by Javier  Corral, a pseudonym for "Juan   Jose de  Corral". From  an early time point forward,  the book takes up the theme of the Spanish  Civil War. It explores the different faces of the Spanish Civil War   through  different points of view, from those  on the left of the political spectrum to  those on the  right. These viewpoints  are explored through the characters of the protagonist and the antagonist.  The  novel takes place  in   the period of 1570-1595.

The  Shepherdess and the  Chimney Sweep  is a novel by Hans Christian  Andersen. It tells the story of two children,  a shepherdess and a  chimney sweep, who  fall in love and are forced  to  part  ways.

The shepherdess, who lives  in the  country, is betrothed to a wealthy man whom she does not  love. The chimney sweep, who   lives in the city, is also  betrothed to a wealthy  woman whom he does not love. The two children  meet one day and instantly  fall in love.

However, their respective betrothals prevent them from being together and they  are  forced to part ways. The shepherdess marries  her wealthy betrothed but is  unhappy.  The chimney sweep also marries  his wealthy betrothed but is   unhappy.

One day, the shepherdess  and  the chimney sweep meet again by chance. They realize that they are still in love with each other and run away together.  They live happily ever after.

Irish Thoroughbred is a novel  by Joanna Campbell, first published in  1981. It is  the first book in  the  Thoroughbred Series.

Hayley Smith is  a  16-year-old girl who  lives in Kentucky.  She is a talented equestrian and has  a passion for horses.    Her father, a successful businessman, buys her a horse named  Lady for her birthday. Hayley is overjoyed and immediately forms  a bond with the horse.

Lady is a thoroughbred and is entered in a local horse  race. Hayley is  determined  to win and  trains hard. On the day of the race, Lady  runs her heart  out but finishes second. Hayley is disappointed but is  still proud of  her horse.

The novel follows Hayley and Lady  as they continue to  race and compete. They  face many challenges along the way but ultimately find success.

In To  Live Forever, Egyptian prince Khattam-Shud,  seeking  to become immortal, develops  a  serum  that instead turns  him  into a vampire. He then  sets out to turn the entire world into  vampires like himself, starting with his own family. However, his sister, Princess Anhura, discovers his plan and barricades herself in a tomb with a group of loyal servants in  order  to protect the world  from her brother's  evil scheme.

The narrator, three-year-old Jeannie, tells the story  of  her life with  her  family in a small town in upstate New York. Jeannie's father is an abusive  alcoholic who often beats her mother. Jeannie's mother  is a domestic violence   victim who   is too  scared to leave her husband.  Jeannie has two older sisters, both of whom are married and   have children of their own. Jeannie's only brother, Billy, was killed in a car  accident when  he was sixteen. Jeannie is the only child still living at home.

Jeannie  tells the story   of her life with her family from her point of view. She describes her father's abusive behavior and her mother's fear. Jeannie also talks about  her own feelings of fear and helplessness. The novel ends  with Jeannie's mother  finally leaving  her father and taking Jeannie   with   her.

The Education of Robert Nifkin is a novel by Daniel Manus Pinkwater, first  published in 1998. It  tells the story of Robert Nifkin, a teenage boy living in New Jersey, who is sent to live with his  uncle in  Chicago after  his parents  are killed  in a car accident. While attending high school  in Chicago,  Nifkin becomes friends   with a group of kids who are into art, music,  and literature. Nifkin also discovers that his uncle is  a member of  a secret society called the speculation  club, which is   devoted to discussing conspiracy theories. When  Nifkin's uncle  is killed, he  inherits a box of evidence that  suggests that his uncle was onto something big.   Nifkin then  sets out to  uncover the truth about the speculation club and  its connection to  a conspiracy that goes all the way to the top of the  government.

"Tunnel Through the Deeps" is a riveting historical  fiction  novel  that takes place  in the late 19th century. The  story follows the ambitious  engineer, Harold Seabright, who dreams of connecting the Old World with the New by constructing   an underwater  tunnel across the Atlantic Ocean. 

The novel begins with Seabright  presenting his  audacious plan  to skeptical investors in  London. Despite  facing  ridicule and rejection, he remains  undeterred  and manages to  secure funding from a  mysterious benefactor. With his team  of engineers and laborers,  Seabright embarks on the monumental  task of  building the tunnel. 

As the  construction progresses,  the team encounters numerous challenges, including unexpected geological formations,  equipment   failures, and dangerous underwater currents. The workers also grapple with claustrophobia, exhaustion, and the constant fear of a catastrophic tunnel collapse. 

Meanwhile, Seabright's  personal life unravels as his obsession  with the tunnel project strains his relationships with his wife  and children. He also becomes entangled in    a web  of political intrigue and corporate espionage, as rival nations  and companies seek  to sabotage the  project. 

In the climactic  final chapters, a major  accident traps Seabright and his team in  the unfinished tunnel. With their oxygen supply dwindling, they must race against time to repair the damage and escape. The  novel ends on a suspenseful  note, leaving readers wondering  whether Seabright's dream will ever become a reality. 

"Tunnel Through the Deeps" is  a compelling exploration of human ambition, perseverance, and the  relentless pursuit  of progress,  set against the backdrop of  a transformative era in  history.

"Irish Thoroughbred" is a captivating novel  that revolves around the life of Adelia "Dee" Cunnane, a  young Irish woman who, after the death of her  uncle, leaves  her homeland to  live with her American uncle,  Paddy Cunnane. Paddy is a horse trainer at Royal Meadows, one   of  the most prestigious horse farms  in  Maryland. 

Dee's life takes a dramatic  turn when  she meets  Travis Grant,  the wealthy and  handsome owner of Royal Meadows. Despite their  different  social statuses, they both share a deep love for horses. Dee's passion and  natural talent for  horse training quickly catch Travis's attention, and he offers her a job at his farm.  

As Dee navigates her new   life in America,  she also finds herself drawn to Travis. Their shared passion for horses brings them closer, and a romantic relationship  blossoms between them. However, their  love is tested by societal expectations, personal insecurities, and the  competitive  world of horse  racing.  

Dee's horse, Irish Thoroughbred, becomes a symbol of her Irish  heritage, her resilience, and  her  dreams. The horse  also  plays a   crucial role in  her relationship with Travis. As they train Irish Thoroughbred  for the upcoming Maryland Derby, they must confront their feelings for  each other and decide whether their love  is worth fighting for.

"Irish Thoroughbred" is  a heartwarming tale of  love, ambition, and the power of dreams. It explores  the challenges of adapting to a new   culture, the  complexities of love across social classes, and  the thrilling world of horse  racing.

The novel revolves around the   life  of its cunning  and captivating  protagonist, Alastair Cross, widely  known as 'The  Dastard. Renowned for his audacious actions and surreptitious  nature, Alastair thrives in a world of chaos and corruption,  using his shrewdness to turn the tides in his favor. Orphaned at a young age, he learns the harsh realities of life  on the  streets and hones  his skills as  a  master manipulator and  notorious thief.

As the story unfolds,  readers are introduced to diverse characters connected  by  Alastair in  some form.  There's the vengeful   police inspector who has made it his  life's mission  to catch The Dastard,  a naive aristocratic lady who falls for his charming facade, and his  gang  of loyal friends who he considers  as his  only family.

Set  against the backdrop of  the gritty,  bustling 19th century London, the novel  captures the tension between the sumptuous lifestyles of the rich and the grueling existence  of the poor.  In the middle of this social divide, Alastair finds an opportunity to manipulate both the  ends to amass power and   wealth.

Alastair's exploits escalate when he becomes involved  in a  political conspiracy. Through a series  of mishaps, he discovers a plot that  threatens  the stability of England. Torn between his self-centered desires  and the growing sense of responsibility  towards his home city, Alastair sets on a path which tests his wit, courage,  and character.

The story reaches its climax when Alastair is faced with an unexpected betrayal,  a heart-wrenching love-triangle, and an intense police hunt. All the  while  trying to foil a  plot which could  plunge the city into  chaos.

"The Dastard" is a thrilling tale of deceit, love, betrayal, and redemption  that shows the  power of human  resilience and the   duality of man. Alastair, with his complex persona, embodies the blurred lines  between   right and  wrong, heroic and  villainous. The novel leaves the  readers questioning whether he  is truly a rogue or just a misunderstood hero in this world of chaos.

"Cat O'Nine Tails"  is a riveting tale of  adventure and mystery  set  in the 18th century Caribbean. The  story  follows  the life of the protagonist,  Captain Nathaniel Black, a notorious yet charismatic  pirate known for his ship, the Cat O'Nine  Tails. The novel opens with Black and his crew embarking on a perilous journey to find the  legendary treasure of the   Aztecs, rumored to be cursed.

As the  narrative unfolds, Black's  past is gradually  revealed. He was once a  respected  British naval  officer, but  a series of unfortunate events led him to  a  life of piracy. The novel delves  into the complexities   of his character, showing his struggle between his  past honor and present infamy.

The story takes  a dramatic turn when Black rescues  a mysterious woman, Isabella, from a shipwreck. Isabella, who possesses  a strange map, claims it leads to the Aztec treasure. Intrigued and smitten, Black agrees  to  help her, unknowingly inviting danger and betrayal onto  his ship.

The  crew faces numerous challenges, including treacherous storms, deadly  sea creatures, and  rival  pirates. As they get closer to the treasure, tensions rise, and  a mutiny brews. Black must not only protect Isabella  but also maintain his authority  over  the crew.

The climax of the novel is a thrilling battle between  Black's crew  and  a  rival pirate ship.   Amidst the chaos, Black and Isabella manage to find the treasure, only to discover that the curse is real. In a twist  of  fate,  they must decide  whether to take the treasure and risk the curse or leave  it and  face   the wrath of the  crew.

"Cat  O'Nine Tails" is a  captivating tale of adventure, love, and betrayal. It explores the thin line between greed and honor, making readers question the true meaning of treasure. The novel ends on a cliffhanger, leaving readers eagerly  awaiting the  next  installment in Captain Black's thrilling saga.

"The Silent  Boy" is a  poignant and thought-provoking  novel that explores the life of  a  mute boy named  Eli. Born into a small, rural town, Eli is unable to speak due to  a   traumatic event in his early childhood. Despite his  inability  to communicate verbally, Eli  possesses an extraordinary  ability to understand and  connect  with the world around him. 

The novel follows Eli's journey as he navigates  through life, facing  the challenges  and prejudices that  come  with his condition.  His parents, struggling to understand their  son's silence,  seek help from various doctors and therapists, but   to no avail. Eli's only solace comes from his bond with  nature and his unique ability to communicate with animals.

Eli's life takes a dramatic turn when  he  befriends a  new girl  in town,   Lucy. Lucy,   unlike others, sees beyond Eli's silence and recognizes his unique abilities.  Their friendship blossoms into a deep bond, and Lucy becomes Eli's voice, defending him against the town's prejudices and helping him navigate through life's challenges.

As the story  unfolds, a  series of mysterious events occur in the town,  leading to a  climactic revelation that shakes  the community to its  core.  Eli, with his unique understanding  of the world, becomes instrumental in uncovering the truth. The  novel ends on a hopeful note, with   Eli finding his  voice in an unexpected way and the town learning  to appreciate his unique abilities.

"The Silent Boy" is a heartwarming  tale of friendship,  acceptance, and the power of understanding beyond words. It  explores the themes of prejudice, acceptance, and the extraordinary abilities that lie  within each of us.

In the small  town of Willow Creek, nothing  much ever   happens.  But for the residents of Oak Street,  that's about  to change.

When  the local church announces plans to shut down the community garden that's been a hub of activity for decades,  the neighbors are shocked and outraged. For some,  the garden is more than  just a place to grow vegetables - it's a symbol of hope, a reminder of  the past, and a source of pride.

For Clara,  who's tended to  the  garden since her husband passed  away, it's a connection to the life they built together.  For Grace, who's struggled  with addiction and loss, it's a  fresh start.  And for   Sam, who's been  away for  years, it's  a reminder of the  life he left behind.

As the   neighbors rally together to save  the garden,  old secrets and  long-buried truths begin to  surface. Clara discovers a letter  from her husband that changes everything she thought she knew about their life together. Grace  finds  herself drawn to a mysterious stranger who's bought  the old Victorian house on the corner. And Sam must confront the past he's been running  from.

As the garden becomes a symbol of hope and renewal, the residents of Oak Street must come  together to fight for what's important  to them. In the  process,  they'll learn that home is more than just a place -  it's a sense of belonging, a connection to  the past,  and  a  promise for the future.

As For  Me and My House is a story of love, loss, and  redemption,  set in a small town  where the past  and present intersect. It's  a novel about   the power of community, the strength of the  human spirit, and  the enduring legacy of hope.

The novel follows the   life  of a man named Joseph, who was orphaned at a young age and grew up  in a group home. Despite the difficult  start to his life,  Joseph is a bright  and ambitious  young man, determined to make a better life for himself. He dreams  of becoming a doctor and one day opening  his own  clinic in the  inner city  to help those  in  need.

As Joseph grows  older, he faces numerous challenges and setbacks,  including  poverty, racism, and personal struggles. However, he never gives up on his dreams,  and with the help of a few supportive mentors and  friends,  he manages to attend college and medical school.

Despite his success, Joseph's past continues  to haunt him, and he struggles to  form  meaningful relationships with those around him. He becomes increasingly obsessed  with the idea of finding his long-lost sister, who was separated from him when they were both young.

As Joseph's  search for  his sister intensifies, he uncovers a web of  secrets  and   lies that threaten to destroy everything he has worked for. He must confront the harsh realities of his past and confront the people who  have hurt him  in order  to find peace and closure.

Throughout the  novel, the author  explores themes  of identity,  family, and redemption, raising questions    about the nature of belonging and the power   of forgiveness. Ultimately,  Joseph's journey  is one of self-discovery, as he learns to  let go of his past  and embrace the future,  finding a sense of purpose  and belonging  in the process.

In a world where  the atmosphere has become  toxic, a young girl named Lily lives in a small community that  has managed to create a bubble of clean air. The community is surrounded by  a thick,  impenetrable  barrier that keeps the  poisonous air out, and the inhabitants within. Lily's life is one of strict routine and control, as the community rations the little air they have and carefully monitors its usage.

One day, while on her daily  task of collecting  water from the nearby river, Lily discovers a small, mysterious object that  has fallen from the  sky. It is a pail, and  it is  filled with a strange, glowing substance that seems to be alive.  Despite the danger, Lily is drawn  to the pail  and  its contents, and she begins to secretly keep it  in her room.

As the days pass, Lily notices that  the pail is slowly leaking, and the air in the community  begins to  change. The once-clear  sky turns hazy, and the air becomes thick with a noxious gas.  The community's leaders, who have always been tight-lipped  about the outside world, seem   to be hiding something.

Lily's curiosity  gets the  better  of her, and  she decides to investigate the pail and its  contents. She discovers that  the glowing substance is actually a  form of algae that can purify the air, and  she realizes that the   pail is a message  from  someone on  the outside, hoping  to help the  community.

As Lily works to understand the  pail and  its potential,   she begins to question the strict rules  and limitations of her community. She starts to   wonder what lies beyond the  barrier,  and whether there is a  way to save the world  beyond their tiny bubble.

Lily's discoveries lead her  to make a dangerous decision: she decides to leave the safety of the community  and  venture  out into the  toxic world,  in search  of answers  and a way  to save  humanity. With the help of a small group of allies, Lily  embarks on a perilous journey that  will take  her  to the  farthest reaches of the world,  and will change her life forever.

The  novel follows  the story of a young woman named Elena, who lives in a  small  town nestled between two rivers that converge into a powerful torrent. She  has  always been fascinated by the torrents and  spends much of her free time exploring their  depths and mysteries.

One day,  while wandering through the river valley, Elena discovers a hidden underwater cave system that seems to stretch on forever.  As she swims  deeper into the  darkness, she begins to experience strange visions  and hear whispers  from an unknown  source.

As  she  delves further into the cave system, Elena realizes that she   is  being pulled towards  something greater than herself  - a force that  could change the course of her life forever.  But  as she struggles to understand  what  this force is and where it  comes  from, she finds herself torn between her love for her  quiet life   in the  town and the thrill of adventure and discovery.

Meanwhile,  rumors begin to spread throughout the town about a mystical power  that dwells  within  the torrents.  Some say it can grant wishes, others claim it holds ancient knowledge, but all agree that it is dangerous and unpredictable.   As more people  become  drawn to the torrents, hoping to tap into its power, tensions  rise and old secrets threaten to surface.

Elena soon  finds herself at the  center  of a  maelstrom, caught between those who  seek to harness the power of the torrents and those  who fear its destructive potential. As the waters continue to  churn  and swirl, she must confront her own doubts and desires, and make a choice that will determine  the  fate  of her town, and perhaps even her own destiny. Will she embrace  the mystery and danger  of the torrents, or will she retreat back to the safety  of  her familiar  life?

The first  storyline  involves  a recon mission to an isolated  Imperial shipyard where the task force is charged  with the mission to ascertain the status of a  prototype Super Star Destroyer. When a reconnaissance  shuttle is  shot down  and crash  lands on the shipyard, Captain Terec is sent  with four Stormtroopers to investigate  the crash and  recover the survivors if possible. Ace Ruck is dispatched by Wedge to  infiltrate the  shipyard on board  Terec's Stormtroopers' shuttle and  rescue anyone who was recovered by Terec's squad. Ruck  manages to  distract the Empire's security forces   long enough to rescue the survivors before the shuttle is destroyed.

Once Wedge realizes that the  crash survivors were Stormtroopers, he realizes that something is very  wrong and has Captain  Karrde  perform a  security sweep on the  survivors. Wedge soon realizes that the Stormtroopers he rescued were part of a unit called Death Squadron, a special  unit that the Empire had employed  with success to secure the Super  Star Destroyer  from a  previous  Star Wars novel entitled Ambush at Corellia. Wedge realizes  that  the Empire may have employed a spy in the previous novel to  provide the information needed by Death Squadron to steal the  Super Star Destroyer and that  information may have been  passed along to him.

## Behind the scenes

The following  is the full text of the  page of  "Wraith  Squadron"   from wikipedia.org:

During a briefing session, Rojer is asked to   create a  plan for an attack on the Imperial  shipyard. On a    map on  the briefing room wall, Rojer decides to infiltrate the shipyard disguised as Stormtroopers. After a  while, Rojer decides to go on an operation in disguise after Draa's suggestion to dress  as Imperial officers. The operation to  infiltrate the shipyard is a success.

> November 1805,  HMS Ramage under Captain James Laurence and his old friend Philip Maitland (an ex-midshipman) are in the Indian Ocean  searching for an English ship lost at Saldanha Bay during a storm with its cargo of  gold belonging to General Sir Arthur  Wellesley and Lord   Castlereagh, Secretary  of State Foreign Affairs and First Lord of the  Admiralty. After  their return via Sri Lanka they hear that Napolon has  invaded  Portugal threatening British trade routes to India  along  with  the safety of Constantinople, the British base against Russia. After stopping briefly in England Ramage returns to duty as  part of Rear Admiral Robert Otway's squadron off the  Spanish coast. A series  of attacks and counterattacks have kept them  busy patrolling Portuguese waters  around  Lisbon  since April, but  the last action was over two months  ago. They continue east on  9  December  past Minorca hoping that Bonaparte will  attack  before   winter ends.

> A Fans Notes (1968) by Frederick  Exley, is an autobiographical account of his life as a  football fan and  alcoholic. It was nominated  for  the National Book Award  in  1970. In it he describes himself as a man who has been drinking since he   was fourteen years old  and  writing about drinking since he was twenty-one. He also writes  that he had been  to more than one thousand professional football  games,  including every game played at Yankee  Stadium during its  first season.

The book is  not available on Amazon or Barnes & Noble but can  be found here.

In  a future world where overpopulation caused by a 500 year drought has forced  people to live  in  tightly sealed underground bunkers, a  young man  is found murdered in his quarters by an apparent robber. The man had left the computer  that controls his home's oxygen and ventilation  system unlocked,  which  leads the police to arrest his neighbor for both  his  murder and  for a botched robbery. The man's father, also named Michael, hires an aging  lawyer   named James  Pendergast to defend his  son,  which Pendergast does  by  proving the neighbor's innocence. Once  he does this, a detective attempts to arrest his  client, only to be shot by the client.  This causes  the district attorney's office to  close the case and  drop the  charges against Pendergast. The attorney is then   asked by the client's father to investigate   the murder of Pendergast's  client,  and after determining that the police have withheld the only  key piece  of evidence, the murder weapon, Pendergast is given permission by the mayor to keep his office  on the  case  and continue his investigation. Pendergast begins to believe  that the  murderer is one of the police officers who arrested his client, an accusation which brings him to the   attention  of  the department. The victim is  later seen  on television  saying goodbye to  his   girlfriend during an interview, which implies  that Pendergast  isn't the target of the case,  but  rather the murdered man   and his girlfriend. Pendergast  continues to  investigate and  eventually finds out  that the  reason for the murder was that the victim was planning to go to a party with  his girlfriend in order to discuss a  plan to flee earth. The district attorney of  the bunker and his brother had previously found out that the boyfriend had been planning to go to the party  with his girlfriend in order to  flee earth and expose the corruption of their father's administration. The district  attorney subsequently murdered the boyfriend in  order to prevent him from leaving and unmasking his corruption. The plot was created by the father of the man who was murdered.

"As For Me and My House" follows the journey of  a young family as  they navigate through the trials and tribulations  of life. The story is set in a small town where  the Smiths, a  family of four, live in a modest home.  The patriarch,  John, is a hard-working  man who provides for his family, while his wife, Mary, stays  at home  to raise their two children.

One day,  the  Smiths' world  is turned upside down when  John  loses his job. With no income, the family struggles  to make ends  meet. They cut back on expenses, but it's not enough to keep  them afloat. As the  situation  worsens, Mary starts to worry about the safety of her family. She considers taking her  children and   leaving John behind.

However, John  refuses to give up on   his family. He works tirelessly to find a new job, but without any  success. As the days go by, tensions  rise  and  the family finds themselves at breaking  point. Just when  things seem  at their   worst, an opportunity falls in John's lap. He's offered a job as a construction worker, and it pays well.

The job  is demanding but John is determined to succeed. He  throws himself into his work and soon, he earns enough money to  provide for his family. With their financial  struggles behind them, the family can focus  on rebuilding their  relationship. They move into a  new home,  bigger and  better than the one they had before.

"As For Me and My House"  is  a story about the resilience and  determination of a family  who faced adversity   together. At its core, it's   a  tale of love and hope, of how  even in the darkest  of times, families can come  together to overcome any  obstacle.

"When We Were Orphans" follows the  story of a young boy named Peter, who is raised  in an orphanage after his  parents are killed in a  tragic accident. Despite  the hardships he faces,  Peter is determined to find his parents and uncover the truth behind  their deaths.

As he grows up, Peter becomes a skilled detective and sets out to solve the case that has haunted him his entire life.  Along the way, he meets a cast   of colorful characters, including a mysterious woman named Amelia, who holds  a  secret that could  change everything.

As Peter delves deeper into the mystery, he begins   to question everything he thought he knew about his parents   and the  world around  him.  With each new discovery, he is forced to confront  the  darkness within himself and the consequences of his  actions.

In  the end, Peter must   make  a choice that  will  determine the  fate of not only himself, but the people he loves  the most. Will he  be able to  find the answers he seeks and bring justice to his parents, or will he be consumed by the darkness  that has   always surrounded him?

In the quaint town of Willowbrook, nestled in the heart of the English countryside, a gentle breeze carries the scent of blooming flowers and the distant sound of laughter. The sun shines brightly, casting a  warm glow over the  cobblestone streets and the charming thatched-roof cottages. It is  in this idyllic setting where the lives  of several characters intertwine, each with their own unique story to tell.

At the  center of  the plot is  a young woman named Emily, who has recently returned to her  childhood home after years of living in  the bustling  city. She has come back to Willowbrook to escape the chaos  of city life and  to reconnect with her roots. As she settles into her  old   family home, she begins to  remember  the memories  of her childhood and the people who played a significant  role   in shaping her into  the person she  is today.

One of the most influential  figures in Emily's   life is her  grandmother, Mary. Known for    her wisdom and kind heart, Mary was a pillar of strength for   her  family. She had a  knack for always knowing the right thing to say and for making people feel seen  and  valued. Even though she has  passed away, her spirit lives on through the stories that Emily   remembers and the lessons she imparted.

Another important  character  in the novel is Tom, a local  farmer  who has known  Emily since she was a child. He is kind-hearted and hardworking, always ready to lend  a helping hand to those in need. As Emily reacquaints herself with  the  people of   Willowbrook,  she finds herself drawn to  Tom and   his simple way of life. She begins to question whether the  fast-paced, materialistic world she left behind  is truly fulfilling.

As Emily explores her   feelings for Tom  and  grapples with the choices she must make about her future,  she  also discovers a long-forgotten family secret. Hidden away  in the attic of her childhood home, she finds  a letter that reveals a   tragic event  from her  family's past.  This revelation forces Emily to confront   her own identity and the legacy she carries as a member of the Willowbrook  community.

The story follows  the lives  of five individuals living in a small town  nestled at the base of a mountain range. As winter begins to thaw and spring approaches, their intertwining  destinies  are brought  to   light.

Firstly, there's Emma, a  young  woman who has just returned home after years away. She is struggling to come to   terms with her past and find her  place in  the town she once knew. Meanwhile, Jack, an old man, is grappling with his own memories as  he  faces the end of his life. He reflects on the choices  he made and the people he loved  along the  way.

Then there's Sarah, a teacher whose passion for her job is matched only by  her love for  the outdoors. She leads a group of students on a field trip  to  explore  the  nearby  mountains, where they   encounter unexpected challenges and discover hidden beauty.

At the  same  time,  Tom, a local farmer,   is facing financial difficulties due to drought  and other natural disasters. He must  make difficult decisions about his land and his  future, all while trying to keep his family afloat.

Finally, there's Lily, a shy  girl who has always felt  like   an outsider. But when she discovers a hidden waterfall deep within the mountains, she finds a new sense of purpose and belonging.  She shares her discovery with  the  others, sparking  a renewed appreciation  for the  power and  beauty of  nature.

As these characters navigate  the  trials and tribulations of daily life, they are forced to confront their fears,  regrets,  and hopes for the future. Through their struggles, they learn valuable lessons about love,  loss,  and the resilience of the human spirit. Ultimately, they emerge from the  torrents  of spring stronger and more  connected than ever before.

A man returns  to the island  in the Pacific where his father  died  in a terrible plane crash, and he  is  told to  find the truth by a psychic and the spirit of  a dead  woman. The story then unfolds  a  twisted web  of  lies and death from WWII to  the present that all come to a head on the island  of death.

Barabbas  is a novel by Pr  Lagerkvist, published in 1949. It is a fictionalized  account of the life of  Jesus Christ, from his birth to  his death. The novel is  written from the point of view of  Barabbas, a Jewish revolutionary who is released from prison by Pontius Pilate in exchange for Jesus.  Barabbas is a fictional character, but the novel is based  on the biblical account  of the life of Jesus.

The novel is written  in    the form of a  diary, with Barabbas writing about his life and the events that led up to his release from prison.  The  novel begins with Barabbas' birth and follows  him through his childhood and adolescence. He is  a rebellious and headstrong  youth, and he becomes involved  in   the Jewish resistance movement against  Roman rule. He is arrested and imprisoned for his involvement  in  the movement, and he is released by Pilate in exchange for Jesus.

The novel follows Barabbas as he tries to make sense  of the events that  have taken place and the role that he has  played in  them. He is  haunted by the memory of  Jesus and the knowledge that he  was released in exchange for him. He is also troubled by the fact that he is still alive while Jesus  is dead.

The novel is a powerful  and moving account of the life of Jesus Christ, told from the perspective  of  a  man who was  released  in exchange for him. It is a story of faith, hope, and redemption, and  it is  a  testament  to  the power of  forgiveness and the  human  spirit.

The novel was adapted into  a film  in 1961, directed by Jerzy Kawalerowicz and starring Max von Sydow as Barabbas. The film  was  nominated for the  Academy Award for  Best Foreign Language Film.

The  novel has been translated into many languages and has  been widely  read and  admired around  the world. It is considered to be one of the most important  and   influential  novels of the 20th century.

Prentice Alvin is a  novel about a young man named Prentice who grows up in a small town in the  American South. Prentice is an outsider, never quite  fitting  in with the other kids  in   town. As he grows  older, he becomes increasingly interested  in the occult and  begins to  explore the darker aspects of   spirituality.

Despite the  disapproval of his family and community, Prentice continues down this path, eventually becoming a successful practitioner of  magic and divination. However, his success comes at a cost,  as  Prentice  becomes increasingly isolated and alienated from those around  him.

As Prentice  reaches middle age,  he begins to question the  choices  he has made and wonders if there might be  a  way to reverse the isolation and loneliness he has experienced. He sets out on a journey to find answers, encountering  a cast of   colorful  characters along the  way.

Through his journey, Prentice learns  that there is more to life  than   just magic and that true happiness and fulfillment can only be found by connecting with others and embracing his own humanity. The  novel is  a poignant  exploration of the  human condition, with themes of loneliness, isolation,  and the search for meaning.

In the  city, a  group of  con artists led by Volpone, a cunning and  greedy old man,  devise a  plan to trick a wealthy and  gullible young  nobleman  named Corvino  into believing that Volpone is dying and needs his  wealth  to pay for a grand funeral. Volpone's accomplices, Mosca and Corvino's own  servant, Bonario, pretend to be religious figures  and convince Corvino to give up his wealth. However, Volpone's plan is foiled when  Corvino's love interest, Celia, discovers the truth and outsmarts the con artists. In the end, Volpone and  his associates  are exposed and  punished for their deceitful ways, while Corvino and  Celia are  able  to find true love and happiness together.

"Ivy, an ambitious young woman from New York City, moves to California with her fianc after he is offered a  high-paying  job in  Silicon Valley. However, Ivy quickly becomes  disillusioned with the superficial lifestyle and lack of meaning she finds there. While exploring   the  beaches near their  home one day, she comes across a mysterious old man  who  tells her  about 'the golden road,' which leads  to purposeful living and true  happiness. With this newfound wisdom, Ivy   embarks on a journey towards self-discovery that takes her  through challenging situations such as coping  with unexpected  heartbreak while navigating different  career  opportunities."

In this spellbinding  debut novel, readers are transported to  a  remote island  where an  enigmatic young  woman  named Lilith has established  herself as the self-proclaimed queen bee of a thriving hive society that operates on a unique system of  laws  and beliefs.  As  whispers about her mysterious past circulate among the colonists who occupy  the neighboring settlement, tensions rise between their two communities,  culminating in a series of events  that force them to confront   the true nature of  their existence and the possible existence of a higher power governing their actions. With intricate  world building and richly drawn characters, The God of  the Hive is   a thought  provoking exploration of faith, power,  sacrifice, love and humanity's constant search for meaning in life.

Former British  Foreign Secretary William  Hague's earnings have been revealed, showing  that he  made a six-figure income in  the past   year. According  to the latest register  of  MPs' financial  interests, Hague earned 820,000  ($1.1 million)  from his various roles, including speaking engagements, consultancy   work, and  writing  books. 

Hague, who served as  Foreign Secretary from 2010 to 2014, has been a prominent figure in British politics for decades.  Since leaving  government, he has capitalized on his  experience and expertise by taking on a  range of  lucrative positions. 

The  register of  MPs' financial   interests provides transparency  and allows the public to  see the additional income earned by Members  of Parliament. It is designed to prevent conflicts of interest and ensure that politicians are not  unduly influenced  by outside  sources.

Hague's earnings have  raised  eyebrows, with some  questioning whether his various roles could  potentially compromise his impartiality. However, he  has defended  his activities,  stating that he is committed to public service  and that his  work outside of politics allows him to  contribute  to important debates and causes.

In addition to his speaking engagements and consultancy  work, Hague has also earned a significant amount from  book sales. He has written several books on topics ranging from politics to history,  which have been well-received by both critics and the public.

Critics argue that the  large sums earned by politicians like Hague highlight the potential for conflicts of interest and the influence of money  in politics.  They argue that  politicians should be  focused solely on serving the public and not  on personal financial  gain.

However, supporters of politicians earning additional income argue that it allows them to bring valuable expertise and experience to their roles.  They argue that  politicians should be able to use their skills and knowledge to contribute to society in a variety of  ways, including   through paid work.

The  debate over politicians' earnings is likely   to continue, with calls for  greater  transparency  and  stricter rules on outside  income.  As public scrutiny of politicians' finances increases, it remains  to be seen how this will impact the future earnings of high-profile figures like William Hague.

Italian drinks company Illva Saronno is reportedly in talks to acquire a stake  in a Chinese winery, as it seeks to tap into  the growing demand for    wine in   China. The move comes as   China's middle class continues to expand and develop a taste  for  Western products, including wine.

Illva Saronno, known for its   popular liqueur brand Disaronno, is said to be in discussions with China's Changyu  Pioneer Wine Company. Changyu is one of China's oldest and largest  winemakers, with a history dating back to  1892. The company has been  actively  expanding its operations in recent  years, acquiring vineyards in France, Spain, and Australia.

China has become one of  the world's largest consumers of  wine, with a market that is expected to continue growing. The country's middle class, which is  estimated to be around 400  million people, has  shown a  growing interest in wine,  particularly imported  varieties. This  has presented an opportunity for foreign  wine producers to enter the Chinese market and establish  a presence.

Illva Saronno's potential investment  in Changyu would  allow the Italian  company to gain  a foothold  in the   Chinese wine market and benefit from  the growing demand. It  would also provide Changyu with access to Illva Saronno's distribution network and  expertise  in the global drinks industry.

The move comes as other international wine producers  have also sought  to  capitalize on China's growing  wine market. French wine giant,  Mot   Hennessy,  recently announced plans to open a  vineyard in China's Ningxia region, known for its favorable grape-growing  conditions.  Australian wine producer, Treasury  Wine Estates, has also been expanding its  presence in China, with a  focus on premium wine brands.

However, entering the  Chinese market is  not  without its   challenges. The country's  wine industry is still  relatively young and faces  competition from both domestic and  international producers.  Additionally, there are cultural differences in taste preferences and drinking  habits that companies  must navigate.

Despite these  challenges, the potential partnership between Illva Saronno and Changyu represents an opportunity for both companies to capitalize on the  growing demand for wine  in China. As the Chinese middle class  continues to expand and develop a taste for Western products,  the wine industry is poised for further growth in the country.

Hollywood film  star Megan Fox has revealed she is  the anonymous benefactor behind a  bid to  save a historic theatre  in Los Angeles. The former Transformers actress  has pledged a substantial  amount of money to  support the  restoration efforts  of the Grauman's Chinese Theatre.

In  a heartfelt statement, Fox  expressed her love for the city's rich film history and her desire to preserve cultural landmarks for  future generations.  The iconic theatre, which first opened its doors in 1927, has hosted  countless movie premieres and  is known  for its  grand architecture and  famous hand and footprints in the cement  courtyard.

The bid to save the theatre comes as a  relief to many residents and film enthusiasts  who  were  concerned about the  future of the iconic  cinema.  Grauman's Chinese Theatre has  faced various challenges in recent years,  including financial difficulties and the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, which forced the closure of  many entertainment venues.

Fox's involvement   in the restoration  project has brought renewed hope  to the  community and the wider film industry.  Her  generous  contribution will not only aid the preservation of the  historical  building  but also  allow for   the  implementation of modern upgrades and improvements to enhance the overall cinematic experience.

The news of Megan Fox's philanthropic  endeavor  has received widespread praise  and recognition. Many have lauded the actress for using  her  platform and resources  to support and sustain a cultural landmark that holds immense significance   in the history  of cinema. As a  testament  to her commitment  to the preservation of arts and culture, Fox is  now being hailed  as both a Hollywood star and a  cultural guardian.

With ongoing discussions and plans underway, it remains to be seen how the restoration project   will unfold. However, the involvement of a high-profile figure like Megan Fox is likely to attract further attention and support from other individuals and organizations passionate about preserving cultural heritage.

The news serves  as a reminder of the vital role that celebrities can play in championing causes close to their hearts. In this case, Megan Fox's  love for film and her devotion  to Los Angeles' cinematic  legacy have prompted her to step up and  make a significant contribution  that will have  a  lasting impact on the local  community and the wider  film  industry.

As the  restoration project  progresses and the iconic Grauman's Chinese Theatre is revived, Megan Fox's involvement will undoubtedly be remembered as a turning  point  in  the theatre's history. Her support not only secures the survival of a beloved landmark but  also reaffirms the importance of   preserving  our  cultural heritage  for future generations to  appreciate and enjoy.

Ballet companies around the world are facing an uncertain future as the COVID-19  pandemic continues to wreak havoc  on the performing arts  industry. With  theaters closed and performances  canceled, dancers and  choreographers are left  in limbo, unsure of  when  they  will be able to return to the stage.

The financial impact  of   the  pandemic has hit ballet companies hard.  Many rely heavily on  ticket sales and donations  to fund  their operations, and with  no performances taking place, their   revenue  streams have dried up. This has  led to layoffs and furloughs, leaving  dancers and staff members struggling to make ends meet.

In  addition to the financial challenges,  the pandemic has also disrupted the training and development of ballet dancers.  With  studios closed  and in-person classes canceled, dancers  have had  to find alternative ways to stay in shape and maintain their technique. Some have turned to online classes and virtual rehearsals, but it is not the same as being in  a studio  with fellow  dancers and instructors.

Furthermore, the lack of  performance  opportunities has left dancers feeling disconnected and unfulfilled. Ballet  is a highly collaborative art form, and the absence of live  performances has deprived dancers of the opportunity to  share  their art with audiences and receive the immediate feedback  and validation   that comes with performing.

There are also concerns about the long-term impact  of  the pandemic on the ballet industry. With theaters  closed and audiences  hesitant to return to crowded  venues, it is unclear when  ballet companies  will be able to resume regular performances. This uncertainty has led to  fears that some companies may  not survive the financial strain and may be forced  to  close their doors  permanently.

Despite  these challenges, the ballet community remains resilient and  determined to find ways to adapt and  survive. Many  companies have been exploring innovative ways  to engage with  audiences, such as live-streamed performances and outdoor shows. Dancers have also been using this time  to explore new creative projects  and collaborations, finding inspiration in the  midst of  adversity.

However, the road to recovery for the ballet industry will not  be easy. It will  require   continued support from governments, philanthropists, and  audiences to ensure that ballet  companies  can weather this storm  and continue to bring  the beauty   and artistry of ballet  to the world. Only time will tell what the future holds for  ballet, but one thing is certain: the passion and dedication of the ballet community will  not waver, even in the face of uncertainty.

American car manufacturer Ford has reported higher-than-expected profits for the first quarter of  this year, thanks   to strong performance from its financial services  division rather than its car sales. The  firm's  net income  reached $3.3bn  (2.4bn), almost double the amount seen in the same period last year.

Ford Credit, the company's financial arm, accounted for a substantial portion of the overall profit. The division reported earnings of $1.1bn (800m), a  remarkable increase  of  60% compared to the  previous year. This surge in profits is mostly attributed to higher  pricing  for used  vehicles, which resulted  in  higher residual values and therefore  better lease  residuals.

In contrast,  the car  manufacturing side  of Ford faced some challenges.  The firm's  global vehicle sales fell by 8% during the first quarter compared  to the  same period  in  2020, largely due to  the ongoing impact of the  COVID-19 pandemic and global  chip shortages disrupting production. However, despite the decline in sales volume, the company managed to offset the losses through higher margins on the vehicles  it did sell.

While Ford's finance division has historically been an important profit contributor, the outperformance of  Ford  Credit  is particularly noteworthy this  quarter. The  finance sector has been a reliable source for  car manufacturers, offsetting any downturns in vehicle sales. Furthermore,  the division's strong performance is indicative  of solid  demand for  cars, as it reflects increased leasing activity. This suggests  that the automotive industry is showing signs of a   steady recovery, reinforcing the overall positive outlook for the sector.

However, challenges remain ahead  for Ford and other car manufacturers.  The ongoing global chip shortage  continues  to hinder production   and is expected  to result in continued  disruptions  in  the coming months. Additionally, the  rapidly expanding electric vehicle market presents both  opportunities and challenges  for traditional automakers like  Ford, as they race to catch up with competitors.

In response, Ford has made significant investments in electric and autonomous vehicle  technologies, aiming to release  a range of new electric  models in  the coming  years. The company is also addressing the chip shortage by working closely with suppliers and exploring alternative solutions to alleviate   the  impact.

Despite the obstacles, Ford's strong financial performance in the  first  quarter reassures investors, demonstrating the resilience and  adaptability of the  company amid a rapidly changing automotive   landscape. With the finance division playing a pivotal role in  bolstering profits, Ford is well-positioned to navigate  future  challenges and  capitalize on  emerging  opportunities in the market.

Judge rules against  former Brexit minister, who earned 600k from TalkTV and Telegraph columns

The BBC can  reveal the  Conservative MP  was paid  122,000 for a column  in the Telegraph and 475,000 from TalkTV. 
The MP for Forest of Dean, who was justice secretary between  September 2022 and July this year, has  had a column in the Telegraph since  November 2016. 

According to accounts filed with the House of Commons, his  earnings from the  newspaper increased from 75,000  in  2019  to 122,000  in 2020. 

Mr. Hague's earnings from his  TalkTV contract were revealed in a document filed at Companies House. 

According to the document, filed on 30 November, the channel agreed  to  pay the former foreign secretary  475,000   "for    the provision of services as  a presenter on TalkTV's current affairs programming".  

The document said the  services would be provided for  two and  a half hours a week  across a   year,  but it did not  say  how much    Mr. Hague  was paid upfront. 

The details emerged in a ruling published on Friday by Judge  Mark Pelling, who is sitting at the High Court in London.   

He ruled against Mr.  Hague,  who had tried to stop the BBC from  reporting  how much he  earned from the two outlets.  

The judge said the MP had not proved there was a "real and not fanciful risk" of violence or intimidation if the information was  made public. 
The ruling comes after a former adviser  to Boris Johnson, Dominic Cummings,  claimed last month that Mr. Hague had "sold out" by taking  money for political commentary.  

At the time, Mr.  Hague said   he  had "never heard  such humbug". 

"People get paid for all sorts of things -  including column-writing,  commentary and speeches  - without losing their right to  express themselves politically," he added. 

"It's absurd to suggest otherwise." 

In his ruling, Judge Pelling  said there was no evidence that Mr. Hague  had planned to step down from his parliamentary seat  or  political office.  

He added that there was no "credible  basis" for alleging that any payment for commentary services  would inhibit  the  MP's ability to perform his  political   duties. 

"As so often in such cases, the court must consider the balance between the claimant's  right to privacy and the defendant's right to  freedom of expression," the judge said. 

"The  defendant's rights outweigh the claimant's in this case."

Illva Saronno will buy  a 10% stake in Chinese wine producer  Grace Vineyard, following a meeting in  Shanghai between Chinese President Xi  Jinping and Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte, according  to reports.
 
The Italian alcohol company, known  for   its  Disaronno liqueur, will buy the stake in Grace Vineyard for an  undisclosed sum, though a report on the WeChat account of  Chinese state  broadcaster CCTV suggested it was about $10m (7.4m).
  
Illva Saronno will gain "a seat on the  board and veto  rights on  key decision", according to  a press release  from Grace Vineyard, quoted  by the South China Morning  Post.
 
The deal comes  as China and Italy seek to strengthen trade links.
  
Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte was among  the first foreign   leaders to meet President Xi Jinping since the coronavirus outbreak engulfed  China, with the  two signing a non-binding agreement to strengthen cooperation.
  
According to CCTV, the two countries also agreed to ease visa restrictions and China promised to buy more Italian  goods, including wine.
 
Grace Vineyard was founded in 1997 by Chinese actress Grace Quoh,  who remains chair  of the company, and is based in the northeastern Chinese province  of  Shandong.
 
According to its website, the   vineyard  makes red, white and  sparkling  wines under   several different labels, as well as a  range  of "health wines".

Film star  Fox behind theatre  bid

The actor who  played Dorothy in the film version of The Wiz is among the  bidders for a  London theatre, the BBC has learned.

Neil Fox, who  also appeared in hit film Bugsy Malone, is part of an anonymous consortium which has made an   offer to buy the Hackney Empire theatre.

The venue's trustees  said they would consider the offer if the consortium could be identified.

TheHackney Empire  Trust has been  trying to  raise 1.3m to buy the theatre since April.

It wants to take over the   running of the theatre from private owners CT Estates, whose  financial  backing for the restoration of the  grade II  listed building dried up during the recession.

The   theatre reopened in  February after  a 25m restoration  funded by CT Estates, but the company  has said it  cannot afford to run the theatre.

In a statement sent to the  BBC,  Mr Fox  said he was making the offer because he believed the theatre "should be available for all members of the local  community and indeed theatre lovers everywhere".

He said  he had set up a number of companies with "business associates" who were in a  position to make the offer.

"We are all extremely keen on  the  theatre and  feel that our offer should at  the  very least be considered  by the trust," he said.

"I find it incredible that they should  dismiss the offer  out of hand, simply because we choose to remain anonymous.

"We have nothing to hide  and our  offer is genuine."

Mr  Fox  played the lead  role of Dorothy  in the Wiz, a  musical  adaptation of  The  Wizard Of Oz, alongside singer  Michael Jackson, who  played the Scarecrow.

She also appeared  in the   BBC's Bedknobs and Broomsticks and ITV's Magic Moments.

Fears raised over ballet's future -bbc.com

The future of one  of  the UK's oldest ballet companies is   in doubt  after poor audience figures and  financial problems.

The Birmingham Royal Ballet is seeking  a 1.8m emergency injection of cash from the city's  council.

The company, which  celebrates its 50th anniversary next  year, says it has been hit by the  downturn in the economy.

It has cancelled this year's production of Nutcracker and says it may have  to sack up  to  half of its 200  dancers.

Council officials will meet   the ballet's trustees on Friday to discuss  the  request for funds.

The company,  which is based at Birmingham Hippodrome, has suffered from falling audiences and has been  forced to  sell its  headquarters in Perry Barr.

In  February, it was  announced  that the BRB's chief executive David  Paltenghi was to step down after 14 years at the helm.

Mr Paltenghi said  at the time the company was  "financially robust",  but added the economic climate was "uncertain".

Ford has  posted a  record quarterly  profit  of $3.6bn, as strong finance arm performances   offset falling car sales.

The carmaker  said it had  benefited from higher prices  and sales of new vehicles in  the  US.

However, sales  were hit by a lack of semiconductor  computer chips, which are  now only available at premium prices.

The global  shortage of chips has forced   several carmakers to  cut production, pushing up prices of both new and used  cars.

Ford   chief executive  Jim Farley  said the company  was " outperform" and focused on executing its plans. The strong financial performance "demonstrates once  again the importance of our customer-focused operational execution and discipline,"  he said.

Ford said  it was now expecting its full-year pre-tax profits to be around  $11.5bn  to $12.5bn, up from  $9bn to $10bn previously.

The company  also said it was generating stronger  profit margins in every region,   including China.

It  reported a  9% increase in revenue to  $40.8bn for the three months to 30 September, compared with the same period in 2020.

Ford's  profit margin - a measure of how much profit it  makes on each vehicle - rose to 13.1%, up from 10.2% a year earlier.

The company said  it had benefited from higher prices for its vehicles sold in  North  America and Europe, as well  as increased sales in its credit division.  It said it expects higher vehicle  pricing to continue.

However, it added that lower production volumes had affected its earnings by about $1.2bn.

Car manufacturers have  struggled with a shortage  of  semiconductors, which is driven by demand for electronic   devices, including smartphones  and laptops, during the pandemic.

Last month, Ford was forced to cut production of its  F-150 pickup  truck - a best-selling vehicle in the US - because  of  the  chip shortage. It also  lowered its  2021 production forecast.

Even though Ford has been   hit by the  chip shortage, like other carmakers, it   has benefited from a broader surge  in demand  for cars and other vehicles  during the pandemic. This has  been driven  by behaviour changes, including a shift towards using personal vehicles for transportation,  as well as government stimulus programmes.

While the chip shortage could linger into  2022, Ford has said it expects the semiconductor situation to get better by the second half of next year.

The  Labour party accused another  Labour MP of allegedly involving  himself  in a  plot to destabilise  the party  yesterday, as the embattled leader, Tony Blair,   continued a series of meetings with Jewish  community  leaders aimed at  calming their fears about his party.

This came as Gordon Brown, the chancellor of the exchequer, received  a symbolic vote of confidence from his backbenchers yesterday, after  suggestions that he had sought  to undermine Mr Blair.

One  backbencher said information had  been sent to all Labour MPs revealing that  Mr Brown had telephoned Jack Dromey, the deputy general secretary of the Transport  and General Workers Union, to demand that  union funding be  stopped from Labour  MPs critical of the government.

China's  biggest  spirits maker, Kweichow Moutai,  has signed a deal to boost its presence  in Italy's booming   wine market by distributing its products through  Illva Saronno,  one of the country's oldest and biggest liquor companies.

The partnership, sealed on  Thursday, gives Illva Saronno, producer of the Disaronno liqueur,  distribution rights to Moutai's portfolio of baijiu,  a distilled grain   spirit usually made from  sorghum.

Illva said  in a statement that the partnership aimed to  "strengthen the presence  of both companies on their  respective home markets and to develop business opportunities in third  countries".

Moutai, whose fiery liquor is a favourite tipple  of China's  ruling Communist  Party elite, has been looking to expand its global  footprint.

The company's lustre has dimmed somewhat in China in recent  months as its flagship baijiu  product has  fallen  out of  favour with some younger consumers, who have turned to   imported spirits such as  Scotch whisky.

However,  it remains immensely popular in China,  with its sales jumping 25% in the first half of  2022,  and  it  is hoping to win  over  new consumers in Europe and elsewhere.

Chinese drinks companies have  been looking to expand abroad as domestic consumption slows and foreign sales of  Chinese spirits, wine and beer are growing quickly.

China's beer giant  Budweiser Brewing  Co Ltd, formed by the merger of Budweiser and local giant Tsingtao, has said  it aims to become one of the world's top 10  beer companies within a  decade.

In  July, Budweiser Brewing signed a deal  with Coca-Cola Co's Costa coffee chain to roll out  a  line of coffee-flavoured drinks in China.

Martina Hingis gave hints  of   a brilliant career when she won the 1997 Wimbledon ladies'  single title as an  unseeded 17-year-old. 

The  Swiss player claimed a total of five  Grand Slam titles, 41 singles titles and a silver medal  at the  2000 Olympic Games in Sydney  before retiring in 2002  aged 22. 

But on Thursday, the  41-year-old  announced on social  media that she will be making an unexpected return to  tennis this month   at the Billie  Jean  King Cup  in Prague.

Hingis will  be representing Switzerland alongside world number 63 Jil Teichmann, Leonie Kng, and Joanne Zger.  "It's time to put on my  team  jersey  again," Hingis posted on Instagram.

The iconic  tennis player retired from the sport for a second time in November 2018 to focus on her  family. 

Hingis has won three Grand Slam titles in women's doubles and six Grand Slam  titles  in mixed doubles.

Figures   released by clubs for the period between 1 February 2021  and 31 January 2022  show Hague's  earnings  ranked behind only Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola, who earned 10,275,000.

Hague  was appointed as  the  Tigers'  head coach  in June 2021,  replacing Grant McCann, who  departed to take charge of Championship club Doncaster Rovers.

Hull  were then relegated from the  Premier League, finishing bottom of the table in the 2020-21 season.

The club earned 34,610,000 in total  player wages during the period, including 6,870,000 in  agent fees and have since been sold to Acun Ilicali for 37m.

Italy have plenty of  reasons to feel confident as they prepare to  face England in their Euro 2020 quarter-final on Saturday.

Not only do  they have a fully  fit squad to  choose from,  but the way they swept aside a highly  rated  Belgian team 2-1  in the last 16  gives them a timely boost.

And  as  manager  Roberto Mancini pointed out on the eve  of the game at Wembley, his team have another important weapon in their arsenal:  the ability to hurt England from set  pieces.

It was, after  all, a stunning free-kick from Leonardo   Spinazzola that sparked them into life  against   Belgium, equalising just before half-time to silence a raucous  crowd in Rome. 

And  with  England having a tendency to switch off at set plays  as shown in their nail-biting 2-1 win  over Germany in  the last 16  it is certainly a chink in their  armoury that Italy plan to exploit.

We have some weapons [from set pieces] and we have  prepared well for them, because England are physically very strong  and they often attack  from  set pieces, Mancini said. 

Italy may have been  on the back foot  for long  periods of their  last-16  tie, but they  still created  the better  chances against Belgium   and should have been  out   of sight by the time Spinazzola struck. 

Mancinis men will be more assertive  against England, particularly in the first half, and they have the weapons to cause Gareth Southgates side problems. 

Italy have plenty of height and physicality  in  their team, but it is the intelligence and movement of their centre-forward Ciro Immobile that is  most impressive. 

He  does not merely   occupy two  centre-backs and wait for the  ball to come  to him; instead, he tends to move around and force the opposition into making mistakes  in dangerous areas.

His header from Marco Verrattis cross was inches away  from giving Italy the lead against Belgium, and he is due a goal  at this  tournament  after working tirelessly in the opening  group  games.

Immobile, who scored 36  goals  in 38  games  for Lazio last season, is  likely  to  be Italys biggest  threat on Saturday. 

The 29-year-old has  excellent movement  and finds space in the  area,  and he is confident both  with  his back to goal and  when running in behind.

Rory McIlroy's second major triumph  of the year continued  after he secured his first major win since 2011 at the Honda Classic at Silverstone.

After an opening nine holes that left him four strokes  behind the   pace set by  Tiger  Woods, he continued to edge the  field to claim his first green jacket at the event.

He  later claimed another major win, adding a 300,000 prize  money to his 9.1m from five  majors.

After  a solid opening round,  McIlroy  shot 71 off the front of the field to finish T2 behind Woods who was five back.

"The confidence  was there in the first few rounds but I have to be proud of the way I finished - especially considering the circumstances," he  said.

"I felt like he and others were holding   me back and that  gave me a huge chip on  my shoulder. I  was on  the  back foot and had to really focus on my  shot and my  driving."

The Scot, 31,  has now won six and  is   now just five behind the record  for   the most majors secured in a  career - all while averaging  just 9.75  over 60 starts.

In a year when McIlroy has claimed  a number of important   victories  - including his first WGC-Cadillac  Championship victory  last February - it came as a surprise when he opted   to back up the victory with another.

A move to a  course  that had little chance of   producing a win didn't help either - but his confidence was on  the rise thanks to a win between two World Golf Championships Tournaments.

And after another solid start he seemed  to  be making  a dent in the  long-term plan of Woods to make a  comeback.

At one  stage it looked as though the US Open champion  was poised to claim his  14th major title before an early  mishit at the 11th  added to his woes.

There was some hope the course at Riviera Country Club, in Florida, had improved  after some encouraging  signs on  18, but McIlroy was in no-man's land  with  the shot on  19 and, to  his credit,  he didn't let go of hope at that point.

By  the middle of the  last week McIlroy became  the fastest  player ever to win at seven straight Majors

Liverpool manager Kenny Dalglish has told his players that goalkeeper Pepe Reina  will not be sold.

Reina joined Liverpool  for 16.4million in 2007,  but since returning to Serie A he  has been used sparingly  as Jurgen Klopp's team  struggles for  goals.

However, with Liverpool looking set to miss out on one top-four finish this  season and their first Champions  League place since  2009,  he  will almost  certainly have an extended stay at  Anfield.
